description.message: LivePage reloads website resources such as CSS, HTML and JavaScript as they change on the server.

browser_action.description: The default tooltip on the icon

@protocol_not_supported.message: Sorry, the protocol used on this page is not supported.
@protocol_not_supported.description: When the protocol used is not support on a URL.

@file_protocol_needs_enabling.message: Sorry, the file:// protocol needs enabling. Please check the "Allow access to file URLs" for LivePage on the extensions page (chrome://chrome/extensions/).
@file_protocol_needs_enabling.description: When the protocol file:// needs enabling

@live.description: The badge text for a live page

@disable_on_this_page.description: Icon hover text to disable LivePage

@disable_on_this_host.description: Icon hover text to disable LivePage for entire host

@enable_on_this_page.description: Icon hover text to enable LivePage

@enable_on_this_host.description: Icon hover text to enable LivePage for entire host

@options_clear_all.description: Options Page: label for button that clears all active URLs

@options_refresh_rate_note.message: Local development can safely be set to less than 175ms, developing on a live production server should be 250ms or higher.

@options_allow_access_to_files.message: To use use the file:// protocol, make sure on the extension page (chrome://chrome/extensions/), you have ticked "Allow access to file URLs" for the LivePage extension.
